EnumType.Name: AccessRights
EnumType.Description: Contains the possible access rights for a user.

Members.Member: The right to append the specified record to another object.
The right to append another record to the specified object.
The right to assign the specified record to another user or team.
The right to create a record.
The right to delete the specified record.
No access.
The right to read the specified type of record.
The right to share the specified record.
The right to update the specified record.

EnumType.Name: AssociatedMenuBehavior
EnumType.Description: Describes the behavior of the associated menu for a one-to-many relationship.

Members.Member: Do not show the associated menu.
Use the collection name for the associated menu.
Use the label for the associated menu.

EnumType.Name: AssociatedMenuGroup
EnumType.Description: Describes the group in which to display the associated menu for an entity relationship

Members.Member: Show the associated menu in the details group.
Show the associated menu in the marketing group.
Show the associated menu in the sales group.
Show the associated menu in the service group.

EnumType.Name: AttributeRequiredLevel
EnumType.Description: Describes the requirement level for an attribute.

Members.Member: The attribute is required to have a value.
No requirements are specified.
It is recommended that the attribute has a value.
The attribute is required to have a value.

EnumType.Name: AttributeTypeCode
EnumType.Description: Describes the type of an attribute.

Members.Member: A big integer attribute.
A Boolean attribute.
An attribute that contains calendar rules.
An attribute that represents a customer.
A date/time attribute.
A decimal attribute.
A double attribute.
An entity name attribute.
An integer attribute.
A lookup attribute.
A managed property attribute.
A memo attribute.
A money attribute.
An owner attribute.
A partylist attribute.
A picklist attribute.
A state attribute.
A status attribute.
A string attribute.
An attribute that is an ID.
An attribute that is created by the system at run time.

EnumType.Name: BusinessNotificationParameterType
EnumType.Description: For internal use only.

Members.Member: For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

EnumType.Name: BusinessNotificationSeverity
EnumType.Description: For internal use only.

Members.Member: For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

EnumType.Name: CascadeType
EnumType.Description: Describes the type of behavior for a specific action applied to the referenced entity in a one-to-many entity relationship.

Members.Member: Perform the action on all active referencing entity records associated with the referenced entity record.
Perform the action on all referencing entity records associated with the referenced entity record.
Do nothing.
Remove the value of the referencing attribute for all referencing entity records associated with the referenced entity record.
Prevent the Referenced entity record from being deleted when referencing entities exist.
Perform the action on all referencing entity records owned by the same user as the referenced entity record.

EnumType.Name: ChannelAccessProfilePrivilegeDepth
EnumType.Description: The privilege depth determines at which levels within the organization hierarchy an external party can act on that type of entity.

Members.Member: The external party can only access records associated with the external party.
The external party can access all entity records in th organization.
The external party cannot access entity records in the organization.
The external party can only access records associated with the external party, or records associated with the parent of the external party.

EnumType.Name: DateTimeFormat
EnumType.Description: Describes the formatting of a DateTimeAttributeMetadata attribute.

Members.Member: Display the date and time.
Display the date only.

EnumType.Name: EndpointAccessType
EnumType.Description: Indicates the type of network access an endpoint has.

Members.Member: Default access. The actual access is determined by the endpoint URL.
Internet access.
Intranet access.

EnumType.Name: EndpointType
EnumType.Description: Identifies the type of service available at an endpoint.

Members.Member: The organization data service.
The organization service.
The Web application service.

EnumType.Name: EntityKeyIndexStatus
EnumType.Description: Represents the enumerator for the entity key status when the index creation job is in progress.

Members.Member: Specifies that the key index creation is active.
Specifies that the key index creation failed.
Specifies that the key index creation is in progress.
Specifies that the key index creation is pending.

EnumType.Name: ImeMode
EnumType.Description: Describes the input method editor mode

Members.Member: Specifies that the IME mode is active.
Specifies that the IME mode is chosen automatically.
Specifies that the IME mode is disabled.
Specifies that the IME mode is inactive.

EnumType.Name: IntegerFormat
EnumType.Description: Describes the formatting of an integer attribute.

Members.Member: Specifies to display the integer as a drop down list of durations.
Specifies the display the integer as a drop down list of installed languages.
Specifies a locale.
Specifies to display an edit field for an integer.
Specifies to display the integer as a drop down list of time zones.

EnumType.Name: ManagedPropertyEvaluationPriority
EnumType.Description: For internal use only.

Members.Member: For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

EnumType.Name: ManagedPropertyOperation
EnumType.Description: For internal use only.

Members.Member: For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

EnumType.Name: ManagedPropertyType
EnumType.Description: For internal use only.

Members.Member: For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

EnumType.Name: OptionSetType
EnumType.Description: Indicates the type of option set.

Members.Member: The option set provides two options for a BooleanAttributeMetadata attribute.
The option set provides a list of options.
The option set represents state options for a StateAttributeMetadata attribute.
The option set represents status options for a StatusAttributeMetadata attribute.

EnumType.Name: OrganizationState
EnumType.Description: Describes the state of the organization.

Members.Member: Specifies that the organization is disabled.
Specifies that the organization is enabled.

EnumType.Name: OwnershipTypes
EnumType.Description: Specifies the type of ownership for an entity.

Members.Member: The entity is owned by a business unit. For internal use only.
The entity is parented by a business unit. For internal use only.
The entity does not have an owner. For internal use only.
The entity is owned by an organization.
The entity is owned by a team. For internal use only.
The entity is owned by a system user.

EnumType.Name: PrivilegeDepth
EnumType.Description: Contains the possible values for the depth of a privilege within a role.

Members.Member: Indicates basic privileges.
Indicates deep privileges.
Indicates global privileges.
Indicates local privileges.

EnumType.Name: PrivilegeType
EnumType.Description: Describes the type of operation for the privilege

Members.Member: The append privilege.
The append to privilege.
The assign privilege.
The create privilege.
The delete privilege.
Specifies no privilege.
The read privilege.
The share privilege.
The write privilege.

EnumType.Name: PropagationOwnershipOptions
EnumType.Description: Contains the possible values for propagation ownership options.

Members.Member: All created activities are assigned to the caller of the API.
Created activities are assigned to respective owners of target members.
There is no change in ownership for the created activities.

EnumType.Name: RelationshipType
EnumType.Description: Specifies the type of entity relationship.

Members.Member: The entity relationship is a Many-to-Many relationship.
The entity relationship is a One-to-Many relationship.

EnumType.Name: RibbonLocationFilters
EnumType.Description: Contains the values for ribbon filters for an entity.

Members.Member: Retrieve all Ribbons. Equivalent to Default.
Retrieve just the form ribbon.
Retrieve just the ribbon displayed for entity grids.
Retrieve just the ribbon displayed when the entity is displayed in a subgrid or associated view.

EnumType.Name: SearchDirection
EnumType.Description: Contains the possible values for the search direction in an appointment request.

Members.Member: Search backward in the calendar.
Search forward in the calendar.

EnumType.Name: SecurityTypes
EnumType.Description: Describes the security type for the relationship.

Members.Member: The Append and AppendTo privileges are checked for create or update operations.
The referencing entity record inherits security from the referenced security record.
No security privileges are checked during create or update operations.
Security for the referencing entity record is derived from the referenced entity record.
Security for the referencing entity record is derived from a pointer record.

EnumType.Name: StringFormat
EnumType.Description: Describes the formatting of a string attribute for the StringAttributeMetadata.Format property. (Deprecated)

Members.Member: Specifies to display the string as an e-mail.
For internal use only.
Specifies to display the string as a phonetic guide.
Specifies to display the string as text. V
Specifies to display the string as a text area.
Specifies to display the string as a ticker symbol.
Specifies to display the string as a URL.
Specifies to display the string as a version number.

EnumType.Name: SubCode
EnumType.Description: Contains the possible values for a subcode, used in scheduling appointments.

Members.Member: A block of time that is already scheduled for an appointment.
A block of time that cannot be committed due to a scheduled break.
A block of time that is committed to perform an action.
A block of time that cannot be scheduled due to a scheduled holiday.
Specifies the capacity of a resource for the specified time interval.
A restriction for a resource for the specified service.
Specifies to filter a resource start time.
A schedulable block of time.
An override to the service cost for the specified time block.
Specifies that a service is restricted during the specified block of time.
A block of time that is tentatively scheduled but not committed.
Specifies free time with no specified restrictions.
A block of time that cannot be scheduled due to a scheduled vacation.

EnumType.Name: TargetFieldType
EnumType.Description: Indicates the attribute type for the target of the InitializeFromRequest message.

Members.Member: Initialize all possible attribute values.
Initialize the attribute values that are valid for create.
Initialize the attribute values that are valid for read.
Initialize the attribute values that are valid for update.

EnumType.Name: TimeCode
EnumType.Description: Contains the possible values for a time code, used when querying a schedule.

Members.Member: The time is available within the working hours of the resource.
The time is committed to an activity.
Use additional filters for the time block such as service cost or service start time.
The time is unavailable.
